page.title: 09COUNTRY PARK,LOWER PENARTH.
page.content: The most peaceful,pretty place in Penarth is{Cosmeston}early on Sunday morning.The{landscape,fauna,and flora, make up this beautiful{country park. Animals and birds live in natural habitats free from man and his machines.There is protection for all flora.The park extends 210 acres,paths and boardwalks surrounds the{two lakes and marsh.One lake has{Swans,Coots,and {Grebes}in bulrushes and reeds.Clues of droppings and empty nutshells indicate the presence of shy{nocturnal mammals, Voles,and Rabbits.Butterflies,the Red Admiral,and{Painted Lady}are found in summer.The{hedgerows}along the road between the lakes have{flowers}such as Primroses,Bluebells,and Yellow Rattle. Areas of{Sedgefen}provide excellent habitats.Take a bird book,flower book, camera,or binoculars and your nature knowledge will increase.
